snippet: Dozens of local and regional projects, which the Obama administration did not include in this year’s budget, managed to received special financing.
abstract: Dozens of local and regional construction projects, which the Obama administration did not include in this year’s budget, managed to receive special financing through money set aside by lawmakers, despite ban on earmarks; critics of trend contend spending amounts to backdoor earmarking, since several of the projects were previously financed through requests inserted into spending bills.
lead_paragraph: Dozens of local and regional projects, which the Obama administration did not include in this year’s budget, managed to received special financing.

headline.seo: Lawmakers Set Aside Money for Construction Projects
headline.main: Lawmakers Set Aside Money for Construction
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers Set Aside Money for Construction
